p: The fatty acids and cardiovascular disease field (in addition to other ones, such as cognitive decline [ 148, 149]) is a rapidly evolving one, mainly due to the difficulty of performing appropriate clinical trials where fatty acids replace carbohydrates rather than one another. However, some firm conclusions can be drawn. The first one concerns SFAs that are highly heterogeneous in nature and whose effects most likely depend on the food matrix and on the other classes of fatty acids they substitute for in the diet. International scientific societies recommend keeping their intake below 10%E, but more attention should be probably paid to their source rather than their absolute amount.
